course_title: Topics in Afr American Studies: Critique of Violence: Law

class_notes:
(Same as PHIL 385 3, CPLT 389 7)
This course explores on one hand, the violence of law, and on the other hand, the laws of (racial) violence; both in light of the institutions of systemic and systematization of anti-black racism. The course takes up critical theories on the topics of anti-blackness, law, and violence to bring into question what shapes political, theological, and ontological bearings of the human, rights, and judgment. The question of political judgment and myth in and against relations of blackness will allow us as a class to think alongside (and often depart from) philosophers of the continental tradition such as Walter Benjamin's "Critique of Violence" and Louis Althusser's "legal ideology" in order to interrogate concepts such as riot, custody, and policing.
course_description: This course explores one of a wide range of topics pertaining to the African American experience in the fields of human and civil rights, social and literary texts, and the social sciences.
